column1: To_prep._ The preposition to primarily indicates approach and arrival
column2: motion made in the direction of a place or thing and attaining it
column4: motion or tendency without arrival; movement toward; -- opposed to from._ Hence
column9: an aim
column10: or anything capable of being regarded as a limit to a tendency
column11: movement
column12: or action; as
column13: he is going to a trade; he is rising to wealth and honor._ In a very general way
column14: and with innumerable varieties of application
column15: to connects transitive verbs with their remoter or indirect object
column16: and adjectives
column18: and neuter or passive verbs with a following noun which limits their action. Its sphere verges upon that of for
column19: but it contains less the idea of design or appropriation; as
column20: these remarks were addressed to a large audience; let us keep this seat to ourselves; a substance sweet to the taste; an event painful to the mind; duty to God and to our parents; a dislike to spirituous liquor._ As sign of the infinitive
column21: to had originally the use of last defined
column22: governing the infinitive as a verbal noun
column23: and connecting it as indirect object with a preceding verb or adjective; thus
column26: ready unto going; good to eat
column28: good for eating; I do my utmost to lead my life pleasantly. But it has come to be the almost constant prefix to the infinitive
column29: even in situations where it has no prepositional meaning
column30: as where the infinitive is direct object or subject; thus
column33: I love learning; to die for one's country is noble
column35: the dying for one's country. Where the infinitive denotes the design or purpose
column36: good usage formerly allowed the prefixing of for to the to; as
column37: what went ye out for see? (Matt. xi. 8)._ In many phrases
column38: and in connection with many other words
column40: or is used elliptically._ Extent; limit; degree of comprehension; inclusion as far as; as
column41: they met us to the number of three hundred._ Effect; end; consequence; as
column42: the prince was flattered to his ruin; he engaged in a war to his cost; violent factions exist to the prejudice of the state._ Apposition; connection; antithesis; opposition; as
column43: they engaged hand to hand._ Accord; adaptation; as
column44: an occupation to his taste; she has a husband to her mind._ Comparison; as
column45: three is to nine as nine is to twenty-seven; it is ten to one that you will offend him._ Addition; union; accumulation._ Accompaniment; as
column46: she sang to his guitar; they danced to the music of a piano._ Character; condition of being; purpose subserved or office filled.
